result.execSummary:
The defendant William Thanadabouth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all appropriate costs. The court ordered that all appropriate cost, surcharges and special assessments be paid from up to 25% of prison funds and as a condition of Extended Supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: To Waukesha County case 11CF855 and any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and/or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving one-half of the initial confinement time

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Thanadabouth

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William Thanadabouth in court with attorney Michael L Chernin.  Defendant William Thanadabouth in custody.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court imposes the following Bifurcated Sentence:
Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be for 1 YEAR, 3 MONTHS consecutive to Waukesha County case #11CF855 and any other sentence.  Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for 1 YEAR with credit for 0 days time served.  Defendant shall serve 3 MONTHS on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and/or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program  after serving one-half of the initial confinement time.  The Court advised the defendant of his determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form 1910 R1.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  The Court ordered that all appropriate costs, surcharges and special assessments be paid from up to 25% of prison funds and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.

Defendant William Thanadabouth in court with attorney Michael L Chernin.  Defendant William Thanadabouth in custody.  Hanna Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hauer).    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.      Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William Thanadabouth in court with attorney Michael L Chernin.  Defendant William Thanadabouth in custody.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    No motion filed.  Case will resolve short of trial.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant William Thanadabouth not in court, in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant William Thanadabouth in court with attorney Michael L Chernin.  Defendant William Thanadabouth in custody.  William Levins for Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant William Thanadabouth in court with attorney Mark A Dluzak.  Defendant William Thanadabouth in custody.   Student Intern Katie Shaw under the supervision of Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
